summary: This document details the execution of a search warrant at 9 East 71st Street, New York, related to the Epstein case. Various electronic devices and storage media were collected as evidence, including computers, hard drives, and USB drives. The warrant was executed on July 11, 2019, and the document outlines the items seized and the individuals involved in the collection process.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Jeffrey Epstein is the primary subject of the search warrant related to child sex trafficking.

persons.context: Brian S. Mitchell is the individual responsible for collecting the items listed in the search warrant.

persons.context: Nicole Dominique Palmer was involved in the collection of USB devices during the search.

persons.name: Sean P. Watson
persons.context: Sean P. Watson approved the search warrant execution.

events.title: Search Warrant Execution
events.description: A search warrant was executed at 9 East 71st Street, New York, resulting in the collection of various electronic devices and storage media.

locations: 9 East 71st Street, New York, New York 10021
keyFacts: The search warrant was executed on July 11, 2019.
Items collected included multiple computers, hard drives, and USB devices.
The warrant was approved by Sean P. Watson.
Brian S. Mitchell was the primary seizing individual during the search.
The document lists various electronic devices collected from different rooms in the property.
